intro: Manglietia caveana, commonly known as the cave manglietia, is a rare and striking tropical evergreen tree native to the humid lowland forests of Mexico. It is characterized by its large, glossy, lance-shaped leaves and its showy, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes some of the most ancient flowering plants. Its unique habitat and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. The species is also notable for its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties.
